answers.answer: I can't speak to the stroke effects, and you should discuss this with your doctor. But what I can do is ask you if you are testing your blood sugar? Sometimes our idea of "eating right" is not eating right as a diabetic. You can find several sources of suggestions for diet but testing two hours after a meal will tell you if the food you are eating is helping you stay in your target range for blood sugar.

blood sugar is normally ok,  i have spiked 2 times in between meals,  and those spikes did cause me  to feel really weird and it seemed to make worse the problems on the left side,  more numb, more prickly, moretingly, and a lot more tightness.   am schedule doc mon if this dont drive me nuts

question: i have type 2/  just diagnosed along with hbp/ and clot stroke.  now, need to know something about the diabetes, i eat  right now, no smoke, am on metformin,  i have at lunch time been having somethinghappen, after eat, i have a numbness on left side since stroke,  this really gets worse after eating ,   get lightheaded, also,  what do you think
title: need some help
